heisigComment: * As a primitive it can mean either rain or weather in general. Because it takes so much space, it usually has to be contracted into a crown by shortening the second and third strokes into a crown.
heisigStory: This kanji, also a primitive, is one of the clearest instances we have of a complex pictograph. The top line is the sky, the next 3 strokes a pair of clouds, and the final 4 dots the rain collected there and waiting to fall.
koohiiStory1: From the ceiling hangs a towel dripping four drops like RAIN.
koohiiStory2: Towel hung out on a line to ....oops, it´s rain.
myStory: mưa. nước rơi ngoài cửa kính
words:
雨具(あまぐ): rain gear
雨天(うてん): rainy weather
梅雨(つゆ): rainy season, rain during the rainy season
雨戸(あまど): (sliding) storm door
雨(あめ): rain
